string.text: The Slavs emerged from obscurity when the westward movement of Germanic tribes in the 5th and 6th centuries started the great migration of the Slavs, who settled the lands abandoned by Germanic tribes fleeing the Huns and their allies. The expansion of the Magyars into the Carpathian Basin and the Germanization of Austria gradually separated the South Slavs from the West and East Slavs. Later Slavic states, which formed in the following centuries, included the Kievan Rus', the Second Bulgarian Empire, the Kingdom of Poland, Duchy of Bohemia, the Kingdom of Croatia, Banate of Bosnia and the Serbian Empire.
